newsitem.title: UK: Europe cotton - firmer asking prices, shy buyers.
newsitem.headline: Europe cotton - firmer asking prices, shy buyers.

text.p: Firmer asking prices for most upland growths of raw cotton marked main European markets on Tuesday.
But the strength of offers, on Monday's rise in New York futures and tightening supply of the current crop, tended to curb buying interest from spinners.

They seemed still not convinced that prices may rise significantly over coming months. Enquiry thus tended to be primarily to test pricing ideas, and was directed mainly to Central Asian and West African styles.
